instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message:
Hi,
i try to solve my first macbook, when i plug the original power adapter 87W, i have nothing on the display.
I dissassemble the mac, the logic board is clean (no liquid). the customer say before this problem, the mac shutdown intermittent.
i measure this Voltage:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>=20V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=8,59V
no led on battery maybe is too low.
can you help me please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> present and not shorted to GND?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message: Then the battery LED on the board should light up. Check all rails for shorts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message:
sorry the light is very low, i see it when i'm in the dark.
i check all rails and i post my result

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message:
I check all rails except <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_E85</SIGNAL>,<SIGNAL>PP5V1_S4SW_CC1</SIGNAL>,<SIGNAL>PP5V1_S4SW_CC2</SIGNAL> i can't measure.
all rails are good except
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL>=20V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V1_S4SW</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S4SW</SIGNAL>=0V
i have only the power adapter without battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message:
The 20V would indicate that the SMC is running and there is communication with the charger. 

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V1_S4SW</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S4SW</SIGNAL>=0V
What does this mean? They are 2 random lines and of course they are all 0V as none of the S4 rails are present. Were all rails checked for short to GND?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message:
I don't undetand duke sorry
i already check the PPxxx with 0V is not short. I check each signal where voltage is generate but i find why the signal is 0V.
When you say S4 rail, it's all signal with S4 in the name? or other thing?
i try with motherboard only with connector usbc and power adapter, do i need more? when i put display, nothing on screen.
on apple service manual, i see use an power adapter 5W when i use the minimal config to boot. do you use 87W adapter?
is it normal all the board heat?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message:
This board will power just fine from any ORIGINAL Apple USB-C charger as it only requires the smallest one?

is it normal all the board heat? What does that mean?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message:
No Title

i check the service manual guide (i have a friend who work for apple service center). you can look the minimal configuration talk about a 5W power adapter.
it's not very important, heat a 40°c (thermalgun), i think it's the CPU. normal? 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V1_S4SW</SIGNAL>,<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S4SW</SIGNAL>, this voltage are necessary to start the mac?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message:
it's not very important, heat a 40°c (thermalgun), i think it's the CPU. normal? 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V1_S4SW</SIGNAL>,<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S4SW</SIGNAL>, this voltage are necessary to start the mac?

Huh? Is the CPU getting warm?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot, no activity
threads.message: That means it is turning on or the CPU power supply is shorted. I don't think there is much hope for this one.
